questionTitle: Which of the following factors are deemed to be important considerations for evaluating cloud solutions?
questionExplanation: In addition to assigning security-provisioned cloud storage to a client or service requester, a cloud storage service provider must be able to deliver a measured level of service.

questionOption1: QoS levels may be applied to different services against a single virtual storage container
questionOption2: An SLA might specify that a particular Quality of Service (QoS) for a virtual storage container may be measured in terms of the I/O per second
questionOption3: To provide for scaling, a virtual storage container must be easily migrated from one storage system to another
questionExplanation: One unique characteristic of cloud-based storage solutions is that they permit rapid scaling, both in terms of performance and storage capacity.

questionTitle: How many categories of backup exist in cloud storage?
questionExplanation: Seven categories of backup exist for cloud storage.

questionOption1: To scale in, the service must allow for stored data to span additional storage systems
questionOption2: To scale up, the service must allow for more disks and more spindles to be provisioned
questionOption3: To increase the capacity of a storage provision, it is necessary to provide the capability to scale up or scale out across storage systems
questionExplanation: Cloud storage systems that successfully scale their provisioned storage for clients often allow for the multiple storage systems to be geographically dispersed and often provide load-balancing services across different storage instances.

questionTitle: Which of the following is not a backup category?
questionExplanation: An image backup creates a complete copy of a volume.

questionTitle: Which of the following backup is also referred to as snapshots?
questionExplanation: Software such as Carbonite may take several days to backup a system, but minutes to create the snapshot.

questionTitle: Which of the following software supplies full system backup?
questionExplanation: An image backup allows a system to do what is referred to as a bare metal restore.

questionTitle: Which of the following backup lets you restore your data to a point in time and saves multiple copies of any file that has been changed?
questionExplanation: At least 10 to 30 copies of previous versions of files should be saved.

questionTitle: The amount of time needed to backup a system is referred to as its _______________
questionExplanation: The first backup is quite slow over an Internet connection, but the incremental backup can be relatively fast.
